context: Hi, what types of movies do you like?
I'm looking for a really exciting action film. Maybe not so much a super hero franchise movie
Have no seen the classics of the genre, like Die Hard (1988)? That should be "have you seen..."
I liked The Avengers (2012) and Deadpool (2016) l, but yeah--something more like Die Hard (1988) d, which I loved Is there anything new out there like that now?
How about Point Break (1991), the original with Patrick Swayze?
You know, I've never actually seen that.
I should get around to that one! Thanks for the ideas!
rec: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three (1974)
resp: If you are willing to watching something older, The Taking of Pelham One Two Three (1974) is very good, better than the reboot, The Taking of Pelham 123 (2009).

context.content: Hi there! Do you have a preference for a movie or TV show genre?
I love thrilling action, exciting adventure, and playful animation all in one movie! Do you have any recommendations for a movie that covers all these genres?
context.feelings: I'm curious to see what movies will be suggested based on my personal preferences. I hope the recommender understands my love for thrilling action, exciting adventure, and playful animation. Let's see what they recommend.

context.content: I recommend "How to Train Your Dragon"! It's a thrilling action-adventure with playful animation that you'll enjoy.
That sounds awesome! Can you tell me more about "How to Train Your Dragon"?
context.feelings: I'm excited to learn more about "How to Train Your Dragon"! I hope it has the perfect mix of thrilling action, exciting adventure, and playful animation. I can't wait to find out more about it!

context.content: "How to Train Your Dragon" is an animated film about a young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons, but ends up befriending one instead. It's filled with thrilling action, exciting adventure, and heartwarming moments. It's a great blend of all the genres you love!

Wow, "How to Train Your Dragon" sounds amazing! I love the idea of a young Viking befriending a dragon. It definitely has all the thrilling action, exciting adventure, and playful animation I'm looking for. I can't wait to watch it! [END]
context.feelings: I love the idea of a young Viking befriending a dragon! It sounds like it has all the thrilling action, exciting adventure, and playful animation I'm looking for. I can't wait to watch "How to Train Your Dragon"!
